name: Introductory Surveys in Premodern History
description: Introductory survey of premodern history with emphasis on regions outside of the ancient Mediterranean world. Three lecture hours a week for one semester.  May be repeated for credit when the topics vary.

name: Introductory Surveys in Roman and Greek History
description: Three lecture hours or two lecture hours and one discussion hour a week for one semester.  May be repeated for credit when the topics vary.

name: Topics in Ancient History
description: Topics in the history of the Greek and Roman empires and the surrounding area. Three lecture hours or two lecture hours and one discussion hour a week for one semester.  May be repeated for credit when the topics vary. Prerequisite: Upper-division standing.

name: Topics in Premodern History
description: Topics in premodern history with emphasis on regions outside of the ancient Mediterranean world. Three lecture hours a week for one semester.  May be repeated for credit when the topics vary. Prerequisite: Upper-division standing.

name: Undergraduate Seminar in Ancient History
description: Restricted to students in the Department of Classics. Lectures, discussion, reading, and research on selected topics in Greek and Roman history. Three lecture hours a week for one semester.  May be repeated for credit when the topics vary. Prerequisite: Upper-division standing.

name: Honors Tutorial Course
description: Supervised conference course for honors candidates in ancient history and classical civilization. Three conference hours a week for two semesters. Prerequisite: For 679HA, upper-division standing and admission to the Ancient History and Classical Civilization Honors Program; for 679HB, Ancient History and Classical Civilization 679HA.
